subject: RE: [junit] how can i pass test result of cactus or junit in txt file or xml file

If u want to it to be done thru a java client, then create a
JUnitTaskRunnerinstance and invoke run() method on it. JUnitTaskRunner is a
class provided by ant to execute its JUnit task. Do not forget to create a
JUnitResultFormatter (in case of xml it will be XMLJUnitResultFormatter),
set it on runner and also set the output (e.g. C:/reports.xml) on the
runner. You can also use the xsl provided with ant to generate an html
report from the xml.

Hope this helps :-)

 

Cheers

yogesh

 

  _____

James Abley

Subject: Re: [junit] how can i pass test result of cactus or junit in txt
file or xml file

 

On 18/07/05, ..TuShaR.. <tvlaad@...> wrote:
> 
>  Hello all
> 
> how can i pass test result of cactus or junit in txt file or xml file?
> 
> in place of printing result on console or in browser i want a result in 
> file 
> format so how can i do so? will any body help me?
> 
> Thanks and Regards
> Tushar...:)
> 
> 
> Use ANT. Check out the JUnit task along with JUnitReport.
